DOC.brief_summary: In men , urinary incontinence ( UI ) relatively uncommon , usually associate form prostate surgery . Thus , one risk surgery benign prostate hyperplasia ( BPH ) postoperative UI . The guideline American Urological Association BPH treatment indicate UI ( 2~5 % ) relevant complication transurethral prostatectomy ( TURP ) . Rassweiler et al. , base review publication state early UI may occur 30-40 % patient TURP . Rigatti et al . report early postoperative urgency UI occur 38.6 % ( TURP ) 44 % ( holmium laser enucleation prostate ; HoLEP ) surgically treated patient 1-month surgery . Recently , follow-up data patient treat HoLEP show transient stress UI develop 44 % HoLEP . Although alternative surgical treatment HoLEP perform safely minimal complication , patient often face debilitate UI postoperative period improvement micturition parameter occurs . Although symptom ameliorates within relatively short time , usually cause significant stress anxiety patient far duration concern . In addition economic cost , UI distress condition major impact patient 's quality life . Social withdrawal , isolation , depression occur patient . Because problem usually temporary , little attempt address issue . Therefore , research devote specifically transient de novo UI associate HoLEP . 1 . The aim present study follow : 1. investigate incidence transient de novo UI HoLEP BPH 2. determine predictor early postoperative transient de novo UI .
DOC.brief_title: Transient Urinary Incontinence After Holmium Laser Enucleation Prostate ( HoLEP )
